sub_title: Principal Investigator, Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition and Behaviour; ELLIS Scholar
summary: I am the principal investigator of the Neural Coding Lab, a scientific manager of the Donders AI for Neurotech Lab and an ELLIS Scholar. My research group combine neural coding with deep learning to model in vivo neural computation with in silico connectionism.

treasury_media.title: Neural Coding Lab
treasury_media.description: Combining neural coding with deep learning to model in vivo neural computation with in silico connectionism. tl;dr: 🧠+🤖=❤️.

publications.name: Total: 70 (First: 18; Co-: 38; Senior: 14); Citations: 3242; h-index: 24; i10-index: 35

authors.headline: Principal Investigator, Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition and Behaviour; ELLIS Scholar

company.name: Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition, and Behaviour

profile_positions.company: Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition, and Behaviour
profile_positions.description:
Research Experience
- Leading the Neural Coding Lab
- (Co-)supervising 12 doctoral candidates as well as having previously co-supervised two doctoral candidates
- Appointed as a European Lab for Learning and Intelligent Systems Scholar
- (Co-)authored 70 articles with 3242 citations, 24 h-index, 35 i10-index and frequent appearances in popular media
- (Co-)funded by ≈€1.5M internal research grants and a ≈€1.5M NWO research grant via CCNLab BV
- Invited for regular peer reviews by high-impact publishers and talks by prestigious institutions

Management Experience
- Co-managing the Donders Artificial Intelligence for Neurotechnology Lab (i.e., an Innovation Center for Artificial Intelligence, which brings together knowledge institutes, industry, and governmental and societal partners in the Netherlands to develop talent and technology in the area of artificial intelligence for neurotechnology)
- Co-edited the special issue “Image and Video Inpainting and Denoising” at IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, and the books “Explainable and Interpretable Models in Computer Vision and Machine Learning” and “Inpainting and Denoising Challenges” at Springer
- Co-chaired the manuscript committee of the University of Toulouse doctoral thesis “Deep Learning and Neuroscience: A Match Made in Heaven?”, and was a steering committee member of the Dutch research consortium "Language in Interaction" and a user committee member of the Dutch research consortium "Neuronal Stimulation for Recovery of Function"
- Co-organised demos, competitions, tutorials and workshops at major conferences
- Established collaborations with international organisations and individuals
profile_positions.title: Principal Investigator

profile_positions.company: Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition, and Behaviour
profile_positions.description:
Teaching Experience
- Coordinating a bachelor's and a master's course, and lecturing in a master’s course as well as having previously coordinated a bachelor's and a master's course, and lectured in two bachelor's and four master's courses
- Supervising two bachelor's and five master's students as well as having previously supervised ≈25 bachelor's and ≈25 master's students with frequent subsequent high-impact publications and presentations, and prestigious internal and external doctoral candidacies

Management Experience
- Coordinated the master's programme, chaired its admission committee, led one of its specialisations and was a programme committee member of the bachelor's programme
- Managed the design, acquisition, build and maintenance of the on-premises graphics processing unit cluster
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor
